content.description: Sit start on tough crimps, and climb the very short face to a comfortable topout on jugs. This is essentially a one-move-wonder to the lip.
content.protection: A pad and an attentive spotter. Just a few feet back from this climb is the arête of the back side of the Alcove Entrance Boulder. It would be very easy to fall backwards off this climb and hit the back of your head on this arête. It's short enough that you don't need a pad under you, so I recommend your spotter hold your pad vertically behind you and watch your head carefully.
content.location: This is to the right of Backseat Hammond, past the small boulder that obstructs some of the wall. It is wedged between the Alcove Island Boulder and Alcove Entrance Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the arête, and climb up jugs to a very comfortable topout.
content.location: This is the arête on the left side of the face, just to the right of some easy slab climbs.

content.description: An awkward start leads to a super fun, big dyno to a ledge, then make another big move to the topout.
content.location: Start with your left hand on a gaston scoop under the graffitied “O” and your right hand on a sharp gaston under the graffitied “H”. Paste on some awkward feet, and then dyno straight up for the lip. After controlling the big swing, do another big move to the second lip on the left, then top out.

content.description: Sit start on a left jug and a right crimp, and climb up the face to the right of the arête past the horizontal seam to top out.
content.location: This is just to the right of Ship's Prow on the graffitied face.

content.description: The Alcove Island Boulder is a large conglomerate puddingstone boulder in the center of the Alcove Area. It is slabby around most of its sides, providing a comfortable seat for resting between climbs on the Main Alcove Wall and the Right Alcove Wall. However, on its back side are a few easy climbs that serve as good warm-ups or cool-downs.
